notes.note: This course can be used to fulfill the social science requirement for HD majors and college credit requirements for other majors in Human Ecology. Enrollment limited to freshmen.

Priority given to COMM majors; CALS seniors, juniors then sophomores. All others by permission only. Students must attend the lecture they wish to add to get on a waitlist. Please contact Danielle Dean-Manzer (dyd1) with any questions.

Pre-req: COMM 1101; six college writing credits or junior standing
Pre-req: COMM 1101; six college writing credits or junior standing
Pre- or corequisite: sophomore standing.
Not open to freshman.
Students from all colleges must register for course by completing an Independent Study Form (Available in 334 Kennedy). Forms must be returned to 334 Kennedy.
Prerequisite: junior, senior, or graduate standing; college-level writing course.

course.subject: COMM
course.course_title: Writing and Editing for Magazines and Online Media

notes.note: Junior or Senior standing. COMM 2310 or equivalent. Preference given to COMM majors. Laptop required.
Prerequisites: sophomore standing.
Prerequisite: Junior Standing
Prerequisite: COMM/INFO 2450. May be taken concurrently with COMM/INFO 2450.
Prerequisites: COMM 2450.
Class is alternate Monday's. Pre- or corequisite: junior or senior standing; present or past undergraduate teaching assistant for COMM course.
Prerequisites: introductory psychology or COMM 1101 or 2200. One evening mid-semester prelim.

Permission of instructor and limited to seniors who major in Sociology, Psychology, Human Development and Economics. Capstone seminar for seniors who are interested in graduate study in scientific disciplines that focus on human behavior. Course is designed to mirror the introductory course SOC/HD 1840 Six Pretty Good Books.

Enrollment limited to: COMM majors or minors (first-, second-, third-, or fourth-year) for 1 credit (minimum 60 hours). May be repeated once for a total of 2 credits. Enroll through form available in 170 Roberts Hall.
Prerequisite: 3.0 GPA. May be repeated up to 6 credits with different supervising faculty member. Students must register using independent study form (available in 140 Roberts Hall).

1-3 credits; may be repeated to 6 credits with different courses. Intended for undergraduates desiring classroom teaching experience. Prerequisite: junior or senior standing; 3.0 GPA (2.7 if teaching assistant for skills development course); permission of faculty member who supervises work and assigns grade. Students must register using independent study form (available in 140 Roberts Hall).
Prerequisite: 3.0 GPA. Enrollment limited to: seniors. May be repeated to 6 credits. Students must register using independent study form (available in 140 Roberts Hall).

course.subject: COMM
course.course_title: Independent Honors Research in Social Science
course.class_descr: Ind Honors Res in Soc Science

notes.note: Prerequisite: requirements for honors program. Enrollment limited to: undergraduates. Enrollment preference given to: students pursuing the research honors thesis in Communication. Students must complete the CALS Honors program application by the third week of the fall semester of their senior year. Students should select a faculty advisor and begin proposal development during their junior year.
Enrollment limited to: graduate students.
Enrollment limited to: communication graduate students or permission of instructor.
Recommended prerequisite: familiarity with basic statistical concepts.

course.course_title: Theory and Research in Group Communication and Decision Making

course.course_title: Structural Equation Modeling Techniques in Social Science Research
